@graph.name: Hearty Black Bean Quesadillas - Quick & Easy - Budget Bytes
@graph.description: These Hearty Black Bean Quesadillas are an easy vegetarian snack or light meal that are filling, flavorful, and freezer-friendly!

@graph.name: Hearty Black Bean Quesadillas
@graph.description: These Hearty Black Bean Quesadillas are an easy vegetarian snack or light meal that are filling, flavorful, and freezer-friendly!

video.name: Hearty Black Bean Quesadillas
video.description: These Hearty Black Bean Quesadillas are an easy vegetarian snack or light meal that is filling, flavorful, and freezer-friendly!

recipeIngredient: 1/4 bunch fresh cilantro (about ½ cup chopped)  ($0.20)

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the black beans and add them to a bowl along with the frozen corn (no need to thaw)
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the black beans and add them to a bowl along with the frozen corn (no need to thaw)

recipeInstructions.text: Finely dice the onion, mince the garlic, and roughly chop the cilantro.
recipeInstructions.name: Finely dice the onion, mince the garlic, and roughly chop the cilantro.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the onion, garlic, cilantro, shredded cheddar, and taco seasoning to the bowl with the beans and corn. Stir until everything is evenly combined and coated in seasoning.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the onion, garlic, cilantro, shredded cheddar, and taco seasoning to the bowl with the beans and corn. Stir until everything is evenly combined and coated in seasoning.

recipeInstructions.text: Place a half cup of the filling on one side of each tortilla and fold over. Cook the quesadillas in a skillet over medium heat on each side until brown and crispy and the cheesy filling has melted. Slice into triangles then serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Place a half cup of the filling on one side of each tortilla and fold over. Cook the quesadillas in a skillet over medium heat on each side until brown and crispy and the cheesy filling has melted. Slice into triangles then serve.

recipeInstructions.text: To freeze the quesadillas, stack the filled and uncooked quesadillas with a piece of parchment paper between each quesadilla. Place in a freezer bag and freeze for up to three months. To reheat either microwave (for a soft quesadilla) or cook in a skillet on low heat (make sure to use low heat so that the filling has time to thaw and melt before the outside burns).
recipeInstructions.name: To freeze the quesadillas, stack the filled and uncooked quesadillas with a piece of parchment paper between each quesadilla. Place in a freezer bag and freeze for up to three months. To reheat either microwave (for a soft quesadilla) or cook in a skillet on low heat (make sure to use low heat so that the filling has time to thaw and melt before the outside burns).
